intro: Gymnocarpium gracilipes, commonly known as the slender-stemmed sandwort, is a low-growing perennial plant native to arctic and alpine regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It belongs to the family Crambe, characterized by its small, fleshy leaves and inconspicuous flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, thriving in cold, harsh environments. Its stems are usually prostrate or ascending, with small, clustered flowers that are often yellow or greenish in color. The fruits are dry, dehiscent capsules that release tiny seeds, aiding in its propagation in its natural habitat.
